newsitem.title: CHINA: EXXON CHINA JV TO BOOST POLYETHYLENE OUTPUT.
newsitem.headline: EXXON CHINA JV TO BOOST POLYETHYLENE OUTPUT.

text.p: A new China refinery and petrochemicals joint venture by Exxon Corp will include the construction of a production line with annual capacity of 450,000 tonnes of polyethylene, the China Daily said on Friday.

Expansion of the Fujian Petrochemical Co Ltd in China's southeastern Fujian province would also involve a polypropylene production line with annual output capacity of 300,000 tonnes, the newspaper said.
Exxon said on Wednesday it was participating in the multibillion dollar joint venture to expand the refinery and build a petrochemical complex.
The project calls for boosting oil refining capacity to 240,000 barrels a day from 80,000 barrels a day and building an ethylene steam cracker with capacity of 600,000 tonnes per year, it said.
The plant was expected to refine high sulphur-bearing crude oil imported from the Middle East, while most production would be sold in southeast China with some exports, the China Daily said.

The joint venture partners would jointly undertake a feasablity study for the project, which was awaiting approval by the State Planning Commission and the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation, it said but gave no details.
